0.text: If you were to ask any of my mates about me...

2.text: Hopefully they'd say I was a great mate,

7.text: and not, "he's just that short bloke that you see on screen all of the time".

11.text: Went out for lunch one day between meetings.

14.text: When the waiter came over, he asked me if I was capable of feeding myself.

18.text: I told him politely that I'd been feeding myself for quite a number of years now!

23.text: I once had this one bartender come out from behind the bar to take my order.

26.text: She bent down and talked to me really slowly.

30.text: she then patted me on the shoulder as if to make me feel better!

34.text: Doctors told me I'd never walk...

43.text: I remember when I was out on the street once,

44.text: I asked someone to give me directions

47.text: but instead of talking to me, they bent down and spoke to my guide dog instead!

51.text: My guide dog is exceptionally well trained...

53.text: but she's just not a Sat Nav!

54.text: You get comments about my disability

56.text: so, you know, they can get a little bit tiring.

59.text: Some people think that I've had an accident in the kitchen

61.text: Maybe I've chopped my hand off with this knife!

62.text: You do get some odd questions sometimes...

66.text: because I use a wheelchair doesn't mean I was in the Paralympics!

69.text: Sometimes when I'm out, people try and high five me.

73.text: You wouldn't just do that to anyone would you?

81.text: You can't see my disability so sometimes, when I'm using disabled spaces

85.text: people take an unusual interest in me.

88.text: One of the things that is really awkward for me

90.text: is when you're out, you're in a nightclub and you're having a great time

93.text: and then all of a sudden, someone comes up and they grab you and they hug you

96.text: and they go "Oh, it's really good to see you getting out mate! You're really brave!"

99.text: And then you're left covered in their lovely sweat from all their dancing...
